intro: Gnidia pedunculata, commonly known as the red-hot poker, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae and is characterized by its striking, fiery red bracts that surround its small yellow flowers. The plant is evergreen and typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils. Its unique appearance makes it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. It thrives in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
